question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What university did José Gildo de Moura Monteiro Júnior attend in 2015?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

Title: The Academic Odyssey of José Gildo de Moura Monteiro Júnior

In the vibrant city of Recife, Pernambuco, Brazil, a young scholar named José Gildo de Moura Monteiro Júnior embarked on a journey that would shape his future and leave an indelible mark on the academic community. This narrative delves into the life of José Gildo, a researcher with an impressive ORCID ID of 0000-0002-8983-8744, and uncovers the evidence that supports his affiliation with the esteemed University of Pernambuco. Chapter 1: The Early Years

José Gildo's fascination with knowledge and discovery began at a tender age. Growing up in Pernambuco, he was surrounded by the rich cultural heritage of Brazil's Northeast region. His parents, both educators, instilled in him a love for learning and encouraged him to pursue higher education. As he navigated the complexities of adolescence, José Gildo's curiosity and thirst for knowledge only intensified. Chapter 2: The University of Pernambuco Beckons

In 2002, José Gildo took a significant step towards realizing his academic aspirations by enrolling in the University of Pernambuco, a public state university renowned for its academic excellence and research opportunities. Located in the heart of Recife, the university offered a diverse range of programs, and José Gildo was drawn to its strong reputation in the fields of science and technology. Evidence 1: University Records

A thorough examination of the University of Pernambuco's records reveals José Gildo's enrollment in the institution. His student ID, 0123456789, is listed in the university's database, along with his course registration and academic performance records. These documents serve as concrete evidence of his attendance at the university. Chapter 3: Academic Pursuits

During his time at the University of Pernambuco, José Gildo immersed himself in his studies, demonstrating a keen interest in research and academic inquiry. He was particularly drawn to the fields of environmental science and ecology, and his undergraduate thesis, titled "Assessing the Impact of Deforestation on Biodiversity in the Atlantic Forest," showcased his burgeoning expertise. Evidence 2: Thesis Publication

José Gildo's undergraduate thesis was published in the University of Pernambuco's academic journal, Revista de Ciências Ambientais, in 2006.
content.source_2: In the year 2033, José Gildo de Moura Monteiro Júnior stepped off the hyperloop train at Seoul Station, his heart racing with excitement and a hint of nervousness. He had just arrived in the bustling metropolis of Seoul, Republic of Korea, ready to embark on a new chapter of his life as a student at the prestigious Seoul National University. As he made his way through the crowded streets, José couldn't help but marvel at the towering skyscrapers and neon-lit billboards that seemed to stretch on forever. The air was thick with the smells of street food and exhaust from the hoverbikes zipping by. It was a far cry from his humble hometown in Brazil, but José was determined to make the most of this opportunity. Over the next seven years, José immersed himself in the vibrant academic community at Seoul National University. He spent long hours in the state-of-the-art labs, pouring over research papers and collaborating with his peers on cutting-edge projects. His focus was on advanced biotechnology, and he was determined to make a name for himself in the field. As the years flew by, José watched as the city around him continued to evolve. The once-futuristic hyperloop train became a staple of daily life, and self-driving cars replaced human-driven vehicles on the roads. Virtual reality contact lenses became the norm, and people walked down the street with augmented reality displays floating in front of their eyes. Despite the rapid pace of progress, José remained committed to his studies. He worked tirelessly under the guidance of his esteemed professors, publishing papers and presenting at conferences. His research on gene editing and regenerative medicine earned him recognition within the academic community, and he began to build a reputation as a rising star in his field. In 2040, José stood on the stage at Seoul National University's commencement ceremony, proudly clutching his diploma. He had accomplished what he set out to do, and more. As he looked out at the sea of faces, he knew that he was ready to take on the world. With his degree in hand, José returned to Brazil, armed with the knowledge and expertise to make a real difference. He went on to establish himself as a leading researcher in his field, collaborating with top institutions and driving innovation forward. As he looked back on his time at Seoul National University, José knew that those seven years had been the catalyst for his success.
